goals.question: What is the distribution of volcano elevation?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of elevation values and their frequency in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano elevation and type?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a significant difference in elevation between different types of volcanoes.

goals.question: What is the distribution of volcano type?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different types of volcanoes in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano type and region?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of different types of volcanoes across different regions.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano elevation and region?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a significant difference in elevation between different regions where volcanoes are located.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['Elevation'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Elevation')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of volcano elevation?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    box_plot = data.boxplot(column='Elevation', by='Type', grid=False)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        box_plot.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title("What is the relationship between volcano elevation and type?")
    plt.suptitle("")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    type_counts = data['Type'].value_counts()
    type_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    plt.xlabel('Type')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of volcano type?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    grouped_data = data.groupby(['Region', 'Type']).size().unstack().fillna(0)
    grouped_data.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    
    plt.title("What is the relationship between volcano type and region?")
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.tight_layout()
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['Region'], data['Elevation'])
    plt.xlabel('Region')
    plt.ylabel('Elevation')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between volcano elevation and region?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
